Topic.Title: a poem about yahoo

Message.Msg: [there never was boards for these ETF's.] wow. how do you make anything investing if you are so clueless about how things really are? successful trading must be highly overrated. all those boards existed but you don't even lift a finger to check before you make such an absurd statement. yhoo is grossly malfunctioning and losing a lot of traffic. management has show itself to be incompetent, totally incapable of running a simple message board. that is a huge red flag. sell now.

Topic.Title: a poem about yahoo

Message.Msg: yesterday was the very worst day for the UVXY mb to be offline. that messed up a lot of traders right there. now multiply that by all the rest of offline boards. yhoo has developed a communication network a lot of traders depend on. management have purposely damaged it, and damaged these traders. they can hide behind their "entertainment value only" disclaimer, but that's for a court to decide. i would join a c/a in a heartbeat. any jury trying to use this mess would rule against them.

Message.Title: Broken Yahoo---They simply never fix the problem
Message.Msg: The following is an example of the breakdown. Their people often don't even pass on a big technical problem to the technical people. "Thank you for the response and the feedback regarding the Yahoo! Calendar. As previously advised, if functionality issues such as the edit event error or script blocking issue occur in the future, please complete the browser troubleshooting steps outlined in my previous correspondence. Once again, please allow me to assure you I would be more that happy to assist you if the Zimbra error occurs. The ticket number for this issue is and it can be re-opened with Engineering at any time. Thank you again for contacting the Yahoo! Concierge Team." IN THIS INSTANCE THE BIGGEST PROBLEMS WERE NEVER FORWARDED TO ENGINEERING BY THE SO CALLED CUSTOMER SERVICE UNIT. certain of the servers are troubled. old protocols, supposedly wiped from the system, show up. certain of the functions work sporadically, and none of th techies know what makes things go bad or even go right again. typically they blame issues on a customer's browser even when it could not possibly be the case Best,

Topic.Title: Guidance, $3B Buyback, 24% Alibaba Group, 35% Yahoo! Japan, Marissa Mayer...

Message.Msg: They are a Yahoo employee roaming the boards. :_)

Message.Title: what did marisa mayer do?
Message.Msg: - Jerry Yang is the one invested in Alibaba that could potentially valued more than Yahoo by next year. - Levinsohn was the the one engineer the selling of some Alibaba stake. - Yahoo has long being the leader of internet media abridging conventional media with online. This was the vision of Jerry Yang and CEO at the time. - Yahoo has long patented social networking platform that FB ripped off and using ... way before Mayer joined the company. - Flickr was acquired way before Mayer was in town. This is also true that all above happened way before Dan Loeb buying up Yahoo. I am all for kicking Yahoo in the butt and get everyone moving. But lets not forget who laid down the foundation for Yahoo. I wish Mayer the best in "polishing" up all the great assets that Yahoo has and make them greater than before ... because I am a long term Yahoo holder. But I also want to be fair. If you have to bring up Microsoft's jackass offer, anything to do with Balmer, you can pretty much write him off as a joke. He got lucky to be working with Nokia ... Nokia independently is a great company and got over 30k patents that they can work on, also owning navteq .... of course, Balmer can not resist being a looser, he won't go exclusive and by doing so he hurts both brands. The only microsoft for cell phone is Android. Too late for Balmer playing Google's game. He got to focus on exclusivity to regain the marketshare from Apple and Google. Instead, he play a looser's game. He should have give Yahoo what they wanted, because even at 35/share, Yahoo still worth alot based on its Asia holdings. Anyway, Yahoo is in good hands and I hope it will go straight up in 2013.
